abstract.p: Brazil's state-owned oil company, Petrobras, begins country's largest public stock offering, selling 16.6 percent stake in company for about $4.4 billion; company plans to maintain 51 percent stake in Petrobras (S)

block.p: Brazil's state-owned oil company, Petrobras, began the country's largest public stock offering, selling a 16.6 percent stake in the company for about $4.4 billion. Initially, shares will be sold to individual Brazilian investors and the government-managed salary- guarantee funds before they are available to domestic and international institutional investors sometime after Aug. 2. Petrobras is awaiting approval from the United Securities and Exchange Commission to sell American depository receipts on the New York Stock Exchange. The government plans to maintain a 51 percent stake in Petrobras.
